answers.answer: Hi there!There is little that can be done to treat chronic infarcts, while management is aimed to prevent such episodes in future. Aside the blood thinning agents and regular monitoring of blood coagulability; the hypertension and the diabetes would need to be strictly controlled, since these can be compounding factors in the condition. For the vertigo, it is advised to consult an ENT specialist or a neurologist for a detailed evaluation and suggestion of an appropriate management plan.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: My mother aged 70 years has hyper tension and diabetic. Her weight is 75 Kgs. Her BP is 170/110. She complained pain on her left side of head. Her neck is stiff. Not able to turn the neck properly. She has history of Virtigo. If she bends forward she gets giddiness. Her CT Scan of Brain showed that lacunar infarct left periventricular white matter of parietal area. Mild cerebral and crebellar atrophy. She is given medicine for thinning her blood.  I request you to advise further course of action.Thank you.Siva Sankar, Hyderabad, India
title: Treatment for lacunar infarct left periventricular white matter
